election_record.label: New York 1801 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: George Clinton and Stephen Van Rensselaer were candidates for Governor.
James Watson received 1 vote as James Jatson.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: Included in the Washington county votes for Lt. Governor are returns, which for a variety of reasons were rejected and not counted in the Official Canvass

sub_unit.name: Stanford
sub_unit.note: James Watson received 4 votes as James Walson.

sub_unit.name: Kings
sub_unit.note: Included in the Kings county votes for Lt. Governor are returns, which for a variety of reasons were rejected and not counted in the Official Canvass

sub_unit.name: Queens
sub_unit.note: Included in the Queens county votes for Lt. Governor are returns, which for a variety of reasons were rejected and not counted in the Official Canvass

sub_unit.name: Westchester
sub_unit.note: Included in the Westchester county votes for Lt. Governor are returns, which for a variety of reasons were rejected and not counted in the Official Canvass

sub_unit.name: Western
sub_unit.note: James Watson received 1 vote as James Jatson.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: Included in the Montgomery county votes for Lt. Governor are returns, which for a variety of reasons were rejected and not counted in the Official Canvass
Jeremiah Van Rensselaer received 1 vote as Jimie Van Rensselaer.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: James Watson received 1 vote as James Jatson.

sub_unit.name: Schoharie
sub_unit.note: Jeremiah Van Rensselaer received 1 vote as Jeremiah Van Rensselaer, Jr.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
Original Election Books. Dutchess County Historian, Poughkeepsie.
American Citizen (New York, NY) and General Advertiser (New York, NY). May 4, 1801.
The Balance, and Columbian Repository (Hudson, NY). June 4, 1801.
